abstract: California Occupational Safety and Health Standards Board votes down regulations that would have required pornographic film actors to wear condoms and other safety apparel after over five hours of testimony from actors saying regulations would negatively impact industry's future in state; proposed rules were designed to protect actors from spread of sexually transmitted diseases.

headline.print_headline: Pornographic Film Actors Fight Proposed Safety Standards
headline.main: Actors in Pornographic Films Fight Proposal to Enforce Safety Regulations

snippet: The California measure, which would force performers to wear condoms and, in some cases, goggles or rubber gloves on camera, was voted down by a safety and health board pending a revised proposal.
lead_paragraph: The California measure, which would force performers to wear condoms and, in some cases, goggles or rubber gloves on camera, was voted down by a safety and health board pending a revised proposal.
